title: Work starts today for Hays Travel to save future of Thomas Cook stores
text:
The acquisition of Thomas Cook’s entire UK store estate by family-run Hays Travel is a fairytale ending to a nightmare month for staff of one of Britain’s best-loved brands.

It throws a lifeline to up to 2,500 redundant employees, many of whom worked for decades at the 178-year-old firm before it collapsed into insolvency last month.

John and Irene Hays are aiming to give “as many as possible” their jobs back. They have already hired 769, including 172 in the 24 hours after the deal was announced.

The married couple, who own and run Hays Travel, the UK’s biggest independent travel agent, pride themselves on their good treatment of workers.
